function_reachability: Is there a call path from function 'main' to function 'printf'?
Is there a call path from function 'print_path' to function 'printf'?
Is it impossible for function 'printf' to reach function 'print_path'?
Is it impossible for function 'printf' to reach function 'main'?
loop_reachability: Can the loop with condition 'i <= n' be skipped entirely?
Is the loop with condition 'i <= n' always executed?
Can the loop with condition 'i <= m' be skipped entirely?
Is the loop with condition 'i <= m' always executed?
dominators: Is there at least one path that reaches the body of the loop with condition 'i <= n' without passing through its header block?
Is there at least one path that reaches the body of the loop with condition 'i <= m' without passing through its header block?
data_dependency: Does the value assigned to 'mx (line 3)' affect subsequent computations?
Does the value assigned to 's (line 4)' affect subsequent computations?
liveness: Is variable 'q' live at the end of function 'max_apple'?
Does variable 'm (line 5)' remain in use at the end of function 'max_apple'?
dead_code: Is the statement 'int i, j;' unreachable?
Can the program actually reach the statement: “printf("a[%d][%d]   ", i-1, j-1);”?
